intro: Amauria dissecta, commonly known as the dissected amaura, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Amauria dissecta thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its delicate appearance and unique leaf structure make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
